#!/bin/bash
echo 'å¼€å§‹æ‰§è¡Œwireguard-install.sh'
set -e

WG_DIR="/etc/wireguard"
KEY_DIR="/tmp/wg-keys"
WG_CONF="$WG_DIR/wg0.conf"
WG_NET_BASE="10.200.200"
WG_PORT=51820
NODE_LIST="$HOME/all-node.txt"

# === Step 0: æ£€æŸ¥èŠ‚ç‚¹åˆ—è¡¨æ–‡ä»¶ ===
if [[ ! -f "$NODE_LIST" ]]; then
 echo "âŒ èŠ‚ç‚¹åˆ—è¡¨æ–‡ä»¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨ï¼š$NODE_LIST"
 exit 1
fi

mkdir -p "$WG_DIR"
mkdir -p "$KEY_DIR"
chmod 700 "$WG_DIR"

# === Step 1: è¯»å– IP åˆ—è¡¨ ===
ALL_IPS=()
while read -r ip; do
 [[ -z "$ip" || "$ip" =~ ^# ]] && continue
 ALL_IPS+=("$ip")
done < "$NODE_LIST"
NODE_COUNT=${#ALL_IPS[@]}

# === Step 2: è·å–å…¬ç½‘IPå‡½æ•°ï¼Œä¼˜å…ˆç”¨ iinti.cnï¼Œå¤±è´¥ç”¨ ipify ===
get_public_ip() {
 ip=$(curl -s https://iinti.cn/conn/getPublicIp)
 if [[ -z "$ip" || "$ip" == "null" ]]; then
 ip=$(curl -s https://api.ipify.org)
 fi
 echo "$ip"
}

echo "å‡†å¤‡è·å–å…¬ç½‘ IP..."
MY_PUBLIC_IP=$(get_public_ip)
if [[ -z "$MY_PUBLIC_IP" ]]; then
 echo "âŒ æ— æ³•è·å–å…¬ç½‘ IPï¼Œé€€å‡º"
 exit 1
fi
echo "è·å–åˆ°å…¬ç½‘ IPï¼š$MY_PUBLIC_IP"

MY_ID=0
for i in "${!ALL_IPS[@]}"; do
 if [[ "${ALL_IPS[$i]}" == "$MY_PUBLIC_IP" ]]; then
 MY_ID=$((i + 1))
 break
 fi
done

if [[ $MY_ID -eq 0 ]]; then
 echo "âŒ æœªåœ¨ all-node.txt ä¸­æ‰¾åˆ°å½“å‰å…¬ç½‘IPï¼š$MY_PUBLIC_IP"
 exit 1
fi

MY_WG_IP="${WG_NET_BASE}.${MY_ID}/24"
MY_KEY_NAME="node${MY_ID}.pub"

echo " å½“å‰èŠ‚ç‚¹ç¼–å·: $MY_ID"
echo " å…¬ç½‘ IP: $MY_PUBLIC_IP"
echo " WireGuard IP: $MY_WG_IP"

# === Step 3: å®‰è£… WireGuardï¼ˆå¦‚æœªå®‰è£…ï¼‰ ===
if ! command -v wg &>/dev/null; then
 echo " å®‰è£… wireguard-tools..."
 apt update && apt install -y wireguard
fi

# === Step 4: ç”Ÿæˆå¯†é’¥ ===
PRIVATE_KEY_FILE="$WG_DIR/privatekey"
PUBLIC_KEY_FILE="$WG_DIR/publickey"

if [ ! -f "$PRIVATE_KEY_FILE" ]; then
 echo " ç”Ÿæˆå¯†é’¥å¯¹..."
 wg genkey | tee "$PRIVATE_KEY_FILE" | wg pubkey > "$PUBLIC_KEY_FILE"
fi

MY_PRIVATE_KEY=$(cat "$PRIVATE_KEY_FILE")
MY_PUBLIC_KEY=$(cat "$PUBLIC_KEY_FILE")

# === Step 5: å†™æœ¬æœºå…¬é’¥åˆ°æœ¬åœ°ç›®å½• ===
echo "$MY_PUBLIC_KEY" > "$KEY_DIR/$MY_KEY_NAME"

# === Step 6: è‡ªåŠ¨å°†æœ¬æœºå…¬é’¥ scp åˆ°å…¶ä»–æ‰€æœ‰èŠ‚ç‚¹çš„ KEY_DIR ===
echo " è‡ªåŠ¨åŒæ­¥å…¬é’¥åˆ°å…¶ä»–èŠ‚ç‚¹..."

for ip in "${ALL_IPS[@]}"; do
 # è·³è¿‡æœ¬æœº
 if [[ "$ip" == "$MY_PUBLIC_IP" ]]; then
 continue
 fi

 echo "â³ å¤åˆ¶å…¬é’¥åˆ° $ip:$KEY_DIR"
 ssh -o ConnectTimeout=5 root@"$ip" "mkdir -p $KEY_DIR && chmod 700 $KEY_DIR"
 scp "$KEY_DIR/$MY_KEY_NAME" root@"$ip":"$KEY_DIR/"
done

# === Step 7: ç­‰å¾…æ‰€æœ‰èŠ‚ç‚¹çš„å…¬é’¥æ–‡ä»¶éƒ½åˆ°é½ ===
echo " ç­‰å¾…æ‰€æœ‰èŠ‚ç‚¹å…¬é’¥å†™å…¥ $KEY_DIR ..."
while true; do
 FOUND_KEYS=$(ls "$KEY_DIR"/*.pub 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
 if [ "$FOUND_KEYS" -ge "$NODE_COUNT" ]; then
 echo "âœ… æ£€æµ‹åˆ°æ‰€æœ‰ $NODE_COUNT ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹çš„å…¬é’¥"
 break
 fi
 echo -n "."
 sleep 2
done

# === Step 8: ç”Ÿæˆ WireGuard é…ç½® ===
echo "âš™ï¸ ç”Ÿæˆ WireGuard é…ç½®: $WG_CONF"

echo "[Interface]" > "$WG_CONF"
echo "Address = $MY_WG_IP" >> "$WG_CONF"
echo "ListenPort = $WG_PORT" >> "$WG_CONF"
echo "PrivateKey = $MY_PRIVATE_KEY" >> "$WG_CONF"
echo >> "$WG_CONF"

for i in "${!ALL_IPS[@]}"; do
 ID=$((i + 1))
 PEER_IP="${ALL_IPS[$i]}"
 PEER_WG_IP="${WG_NET_BASE}.${ID}/32"

 if [ "$ID" -eq "$MY_ID" ]; then
 continue
 fi

 PEER_KEY_FILE="$KEY_DIR/node${ID}.pub"
 if [ ! -f "$PEER_KEY_FILE" ]; then
 echo "âŒ ç¼ºå°‘ $PEER_KEY_FILEï¼Œé€€å‡º"
 exit 1
 fi

 PEER_KEY=$(cat "$PEER_KEY_FILE")
 echo "[Peer]" >> "$WG_CONF"
 echo "PublicKey = $PEER_KEY" >> "$WG_CONF"
 echo "AllowedIPs = $PEER_WG_IP" >> "$WG_CONF"
 echo "Endpoint = $PEER_IP:$WG_PORT" >> "$WG_CONF"
 echo "PersistentKeepalive = 25" >> "$WG_CONF"
 echo >> "$WG_CONF"
done

# === Step 9: å¯åŠ¨ WireGuard ===
echo " å¯åŠ¨ WireGuard..."
systemctl stop wg-quick@wg0 &>/dev/null || true
wg-quick up wg0
systemctl enable wg-quick@wg0

echo "âœ… å¯åŠ¨æˆåŠŸï¼Œå½“å‰èŠ‚ç‚¹ WireGuard IP: ${WG_NET_BASE}.${MY_ID}"
echo " æŸ¥çœ‹çŠ¶æ€: wg show"

æŠ˜è…¾ä¸€ä¸‹åŸºæœ¬å®ç°äº†è·¨äº‘å†…ç½‘äº’é€šï¼Œå»¶è¿Ÿåœ¨å¯æ¥å—è®¿é—®å†…ã€‚

 const images = document.getElementsByClassName("woo-picture-img");

FROM node:20-alpine AS build-env

WORKDIR /home/node/app

RUN chown -R node:node /home/node/app

USER node

COPY package*.json ./

COPY --chown=node:node . .
RUN yarn install
ENV NODE_ENV=production
# if you want to use your own meilisearch server, you can set the following env
# ENV REACT_APP_MEILI_SERVER_ADDRESS=http://meilisearch:7700
# ENV REACT_APP_MEILI_API_KEY=masterKey
RUN yarn build

FROM nginx
COPY --from=build-env /home/node/app/build/ /usr/share/nginx/html/

Docker with Nginx

nginx is also available in the Docker image.

You can use it to serve the mini-dashboard.

1
2

docker build --build-arg REACT_APP_MEILI_SERVER_ADDRESS=http://meilisearch:7700 -t meilisearch-mini-dashboard-nginx . -f Dockerfile.nginx
docker run -p 8080:80 meilisearch-mini-dashboard-nginx

You can then access the mini-dashboard at http://localhost:8080.

import psutil
import cpuinfo
import GPUtil
import platform
import json

def get_cpu_info():
 try:
 cpu = cpuinfo.get_cpu_info()
 return cpu['brand_raw']
 except Exception as e:
 return f"Unknown CPU ({e})"

def get_gpu_info():
 try:
 gpus = GPUtil.getGPUs()
 return " | ".join([gpu.name for gpu in gpus])
 except Exception as e:
 return f"Unknown GPU ({e})"

def get_ram_info():
 try:
 if platform.system() == "Windows":
 import wmi
 c = wmi.WMI()
 for memory in c.Win32_PhysicalMemory():
 ram_vendor = memory.Manufacturer
 ram_serial_number = memory.SerialNumber
 ram_total_size = int(memory.Capacity)
 ram_free_size = psutil.virtual_memory().available
 return ram_vendor, ram_serial_number, ram_total_size, ram_free_size
 else:
 vm = psutil.virtual_memory()
 return "Unknown Vendor", "Unknown Serial", vm.total, vm.available
 except Exception as e:
 return "Unknown Vendor", "Unknown Serial", -1, -1

def get_mainboard_info():
 try:
 if platform.system() == "Windows":
 import wmi
 c = wmi.WMI()
 for board in c.Win32_BaseBoard():
 mainboard_vendor = board.Manufacturer
 mainboard_name = board.Product
 mainboard_serial = board.SerialNumber
 return mainboard_vendor, mainboard_name, mainboard_serial
 else:
 return "Unknown Vendor", "Unknown Board", "Unknown Serial"
 except Exception as e:
 return "Unknown Vendor", "Unknown Board", f"Unknown Serial ({e})"

def get_disk_info():
 try:
 if platform.system() == "Windows":
 import wmi
 c = wmi.WMI()
 disks = []
 for disk in c.Win32_DiskDrive():
 model = disk.Model
 serial_number = disk.SerialNumber.strip()
 size = int(disk.Size)
 disks.append({
 "model": model,
 "serialNumber": serial_number,
 "size": size,
 "freeSize": -1
 })
 return disks
 else:
 disks = []
 for disk in psutil.disk_partitions():
 usage = psutil.disk_usage(disk.mountpoint)
 disks.append({
 "model": "Unknown Model",
 "serialNumber": "Unknown Serial",
 "size": usage.total,
 "freeSize": usage.free
 })
 return disks
 except Exception as e:
 return [{"model": "Unknown", "serialNumber": "Unknown", "size": -1, "freeSize": -1}]

def get_os_info():
 try:
 os_version = platform.version()
 os_short_name = platform.system()
 os_arch = platform.architecture()[0]
 return os_version, os_short_name, os_arch
 except Exception as e:
 return "Unknown", "Unknown", "Unknown"

def get_total_disk_size_and_free_space():
 try:
 total_size = 0
 total_free_space = 0
 for partition in psutil.disk_partitions():
 try:
 usage = psutil.disk_usage(partition.mountpoint)
 total_size += usage.total
 total_free_space += usage.free
 except PermissionError:
 continue # é¿å…æŸäº›ç£ç›˜æ²¡æœ‰æƒé™è®¿é—®å¯¼è‡´çš„é”™è¯¯
 return total_size, total_free_space
 except Exception as e:
 return -1, -1

def get_hardware_info():
 cpu_model = get_cpu_info()
 gpu_name = get_gpu_info()
 ram_vendor, ram_serial_number, ram_total_size, ram_free_size = get_ram_info()
 mainboard_vendor, mainboard_name, mainboard_serial_number = get_mainboard_info()
 disks = get_disk_info()
 os_version, os_short_name, os_arch = get_os_info()
 total_disk_size, total_free_space = get_total_disk_size_and_free_space()

 return {
 "cpuModel": cpu_model,
 "gpuName": gpu_name,
 "ramVendor": ram_vendor,
 "ramSerialNumber": ram_serial_number,
 "ramTotalSizeBytes": ram_total_size,
 "ramFreeSizeBytes": ram_free_size,
 "mainBoardVendor": mainboard_vendor,
 "mainBoardName": mainboard_name,
 "mainBoardSerialNumber": mainboard_serial_number,
 "disks": disks,
 "osOperatingSystem": os_version,
 "osShortName": os_short_name,
 "osArchitecture": os_arch,
 "diskTotalSize": total_disk_size,
 "logicDiskTotalFreeSpace": total_free_space
 }

if __name__ == "__main__":
 hardware_info = get_hardware_info()
 print(json.dumps(hardware_info, indent=2))

import psutil
import GPUtil
import platform
import json
import time
import subprocess
from functools import wraps
from loguru import logger
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

# é…ç½® loguru å°†æ—¥å¿—è¾“å‡ºåˆ°æ ‡å‡†è¾“å‡º
logger.remove()
logger.add(lambda msg: print(msg, end=''))

# è‡ªå®šä¹‰ç¼“å­˜è£…é¥°å™¨
def timed_lru_cache(seconds: int, maxsize: int = 128):
 def wrapper(func):
 cache = {}
 cache_expiration = {}

 @wraps(func)
 def inner(*args):
 now = datetime.now()
 # æ¸…é™¤è¿‡æœŸç¼“å­˜
 for key in list(cache_expiration):
 if cache_expiration[key] < now:
 cache.pop(key, None)
 cache_expiration.pop(key, None)

 if args in cache:
 return cache[args]

 result = func(*args)
 cache[args] = result
 cache_expiration[args] = now + timedelta(seconds=seconds)

 if len(cache) > maxsize:
 oldest = min(cache_expiration, key=cache_expiration.get)
 cache.pop(oldest, None)
 cache_expiration.pop(oldest, None)

 return result

 return inner
 return wrapper

@timed_lru_cache(60)
def get_cpu_info():
 start_time = time.time()
 try:
 if platform.system() == "Windows":
 result = subprocess.run(['wmic', 'cpu', 'get', 'Name'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
 cpu_model = result.stdout.split('\n')[1].strip()
 elif platform.system() == "Linux":
 result = subprocess.run(['lscpu'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
 for line in result.stdout.split('\n'):
 if 'Model name' in line:
 cpu_model = line.split(':')[1].strip()
 break
 elif platform.system() == "Darwin":
 result = subprocess.run(['sysctl', '-n', 'machdep.cpu.brand_string'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
 cpu_model = result.stdout.strip()
 else:
 cpu_model = "Unsupported platform"
 except Exception as e:
 cpu_model = f"Unknown CPU ({e})"
 end_time = time.time()
 logger.info(f"get_cpu_info() took {end_time - start_time:.3f} seconds")
 return cpu_model

@timed_lru_cache(60)
def get_gpu_info():
 start_time = time.time()
 try:
 gpus = GPUtil.getGPUs()
 gpu_name = " | ".join([gpu.name for gpu in gpus])
 except Exception as e:
 gpu_name = f"Unknown GPU ({e})"
 end_time = time.time()
 logger.info(f"get_gpu_info() took {end_time - start_time:.3f} seconds")
 return gpu_name

@timed_lru_cache(60)
def get_ram_info():
 start_time = time.time()
 try:
 if platform.system() == "Windows":
 import wmi
 c = wmi.WMI()
 for memory in c.Win32_PhysicalMemory():
 ram_vendor = memory.Manufacturer
 ram_serial_number = memory.SerialNumber
 ram_total_size = int(memory.Capacity)
 ram_free_size = psutil.virtual_memory().available
 break
 else:
 vm = psutil.virtual_memory()
 ram_vendor, ram_serial_number, ram_total_size, ram_free_size = "Unknown Vendor", "Unknown Serial", vm.total, vm.available
 except Exception as e:
 ram_vendor, ram_serial_number, ram_total_size, ram_free_size = "Unknown Vendor", "Unknown Serial", -1, -1
 end_time = time.time()
 logger.info(f"get_ram_info() took {end_time - start_time:.3f} seconds")
 return ram_vendor, ram_serial_number, ram_total_size, ram_free_size

A Visual Studio Code extension that provides rich language support for C# and is shipped along with C# Dev Kit.
